item.title: Make diacritics easy in Linux
item.description: Diacritics are all of the small things that are added on, above, or below certain characters in various languages. Some examples include tildes (Ã±), accents (Ã¡), or other marks (Å¡). These marks are little hints that help you know how to pronounce a word properly (and they sometimes change the definition of a word entirely). They are often skipped by non-native language speakers, and sometimes even by native speakers, but I have done my best to make a habit of including them when I can.
